column4: Hello -- sorry for bothering everyone here, but I would like to know if anyone has been successful in getting a linksys PCMCIA card (WPC54GS) to work with the latest version of this distro.  I have tried to do it via the website (went through NDISWRAPPER) etc -- so I want to know if anyone here has done it.
i have a PCMCIA card that works with ndiswrapper
(sorry didn't look at screen up close): I attempted to load ndiswrapper and it didn't work.  If you don't mind, what steps did you take?
i followed the steps on that Ubuntu Wiki ndiswrapper guide
you have to remember to blacklist the alternate driver module
i added blacklist bcm43xx to the end of my /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist
because ndiswrapper -l as alternate driver that conflicts with ndiswrapper
ok I will give that a shot.
to check if your wireless card driver has loaded properly, ndiswrapper -l
